Description: Rim fragment of red-figured pottery kylix, outside: part of a head to the left, wearing a purple headband, drapery. Probably a man leaning on a stick.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Part of the same cup as AN1896-1908-G.138.3,5 and 11.
Bibliographic references: CVA Oxford I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain Fasc. 3, Oxford Fasc. 1 (pl. 14.29)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1509)
